channel.title: Comments on: Working In A Terabyte World

item.title: By: Evan Eickmeyer
item.dc:creator: Evan Eickmeyer
item.description:
Jim, don't forget that their corollary philosophy was, "Nobody will ever need more storage than the 160 k capacity of a single-sided 5.25" floppy."
Joseph, the second beta of the Windows Server 2003 R2 update was released in April and is "slated to ship by the end of calendar 2005." See , , and for more.
item.content:encoded:
Jim, don’t forget that their corollary philosophy was, “Nobody will ever need more storage than the 160 k capacity of a single-sided 5.25″ floppy.”

Joseph, the second beta of the Windows Server 2003 R2 update was released in April and is “slated to ship by the end of calendar 2005.” See , , and for more.

item.title: By: Jim
item.dc:creator: Jim
item.description: What do you expect from a company whose basic philosophy was, "Nobody will <em>ever</em> need more than 640 k of memory!" ;)
item.content:encoded:
What do you expect from a company whose basic philosophy was, “Nobody will ever need more than 640 k of memory!”
